title: Vikings' Ida Marie Nielsen treats fans to BTS tour ahead of season 6
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Vikings’ Ida Marie Nielsen has treated her fans to a series of behind the scenes videos from the History Channel hit.

The actress played Margrethe in the popular show, and despite being killed off back in season five, it seems she has a whole host of never before seen footage ready to share with the world.

Taking to Instagram, the 23-year-old uploaded her first round of videos, and they’re too cute.

Holding onto Ivar The Boneless’s (Alex Høgh Andersen) crutch, the star hobbled along before laughing: ‘My handy dandy something.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

She then took us over to her character’s house, where she introduced the clip, by saying: ‘Hi guys, welcome to Kattegat, my home.’

Opening the door to her little hut, Ida smiled: ‘So in here is my room, my house, come with me to my crib.’

Vikings star Ida Marie Nielsen gets ‘nostalgic’ (Picture: @ida_marie_nielsen / Instagram)

Shocked at what she found, the star sarcastically laughed: ‘Oh, I think they took it down. It doesn’t really look that nice, a small space… but it’s good, yeah’.

She later shared another video of herself opening two huge red doors, as she shouted: ‘Hey, I’ve been upgraded, this is my new crib.’

Beaming into the camera, the actress whispered: ‘It’s the whole of England.’

Alongside the videos, she wrote to her followers: ‘A trip down memory lane aka the Viking era. ⠀

She’s shared a series of behind the scenes videos (Picture: History)

‘I’m sick in bed, and since I can’t be in school and gain new wisdom I’m going to look back at what I’ve accomplished so far.’

Ida added: ‘It really is helpful to look at happy healthy photos of yourself when feeling like s**t.

‘I have many funny and awkward Viking photos I haven’t shared. It is hilarious to look back at! I’m sooo young and blonde haha.’

Explaining the random tour, she went onto tell the Vikings fandom of her exciting day off while on set.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I had a day of from work while filming Vikings. I chose to spend the day making a few behind the scenes videos,’ she wrote.

‘The result was disappointing, probably not my finest work. But now three years later I’m ready to share them with you. Haha. Enjoy! I’m a bit nostalgic these days.’

Vikings will come to an end after season six, which is set to drop on the History Channel and Amazon Prime 4 December.

description: Vikings star Ida Marie Nielsen gets 'nostalgic' as she treats fans to BTS tour of Kattegat ahead of season 6.
